instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight comes late
threads.message:
Hi guys, I could use some help, can't get any further.
I swapped the display on an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) (2015). When booting, the screen has no backlight until the loading bar has reached about 80%.
I noticed that when I turned it on the charging cable (85W original) shows orange for a short moment, then green -> orange as normal. No idea if it have something to do with the backlight problem.
At <CAPACITOR>C8303</CAPACITOR>: 1 <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> I measure 49V at start (without backlight), as soon as the backlight switches on 40V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight comes late
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What's the problem of original LCD?
Connect it back and check how backlight starts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight comes late
threads.message:
Thank you, nice to be here :)
The original display shows a picture completely without backlight, with another display the backlight turns on immediately. We tested all 3 displays with the same result on a different board.
Is there a way to fix the display with the late backlight?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight comes late
threads.message:
So other screen has the same issue on this board?
Are you sure all of them are 2015?
Did PRAM reset 2-3 times?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight comes late
threads.message:
The 3 displays behave differently on this board. I tested the displays on another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board. The behavior of the displays remains the same, which leads me to assume that it is the display and not the board. 

Can you tell on the display whether it's 2013/14 or 2015? 

When replacing the display (backlight comes late) I reset the PRAM 5x. Should I reset the PRAM every time I change the display, or is that enough?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight comes late
threads.message:
Nothing to lose if do it each time.

Any of the 3 displays gets backlight faster than other?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight comes late
threads.message:
I did each time. No changes. 

Yes, one get backlight from the beginning (as usual), the second one when booting bar is at 80% and the third one never.

Ist there a way to see what type of Display I have (2014 or 2015)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight comes late
threads.message:
Then you have a LCD issue and must get the correct model.
The one which get fast backlight, is for 2015  ;).
